alert.note: Alert for Houston; Winona (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 31 at 9:42AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Slippery, Hazardous Travel In Snow Showers This Morning... Snow covered roads with icy spots are making for slippery to hazardous travel for many this morning, especially portions of southeast Minnesota and western into north-central Wisconsin. Bridges and overpasses are especially treacherous with melting snow refreezing...resulting in icy conditions. Bands of snow, with pockets of moderate to heavy snow, will continue to rotate across and through the local area through late morning. Visibilities in the heavy snow will quickly drop to 1/2 mile. Additional snowfall of up to 1" is possible, mostly on cold and grassy surfaces. In addition, winds will gust from 30 to 40 mph at times. Numerous accidents and slide offs have already occurred this morning. If you must travel, be prepared for the winter driving conditions...especially across bridges and overpasses. Take it slow and allow for ample time to reach your destination.
